results.description:
***Please bring water for your dogs.**

Friday will be partly sunny & 55 degrees, wind at 20 mph, with no chance of rain :D  Wear a hat that won't fly off in the wind :)  Please read directions below to find the Meeting Place (which is not the regular parking lot for the park) :

Park at the Lakeview Office Park, 9821 Broken Land Parkway parking lot on the other side of Broken Land Parkway from the dam end of Lake Elkhorn, Columbia, MD, 21046.  Please read the whole  description below:


WHERE TO MEET

Please go to the LAKEVIEW Office Park at 9821 Broken Land Parkway, Columbia, MD 21046.   Go to the driveway in front of the buildings and turn left.  Park by the edge of the woods.  Please take your dog out of the car, and look for people with dogs.  They will be looking for you & your dog too :)


•  (If you are coming from Broken Land Parkway at the Columbia Mall direction, it is easier to turn into the Woodmere Office Park, at  9891 Broken Land Parkway, because it's at a traffic light, and you just turn right to get into it.  Also because it's really easy to pass by the entrance to Lakeview Office Park, which is over a hill.  If you turn in here, drive toward the metal sculpture, and TURN LEFT to continue on to LAKEVIEW OFFICE PARK AT 9821 Broken Land Parkway.  Stay on this driveway, go through a stop sign, and continue driving, passing by all of the buildings on your right.  Keep driving all the way to the end, til you can't drive any further, and park at the edge of the WOODS.)

• When you get out of the car, you should be able to see Lake Elkhorn from the parking lot.  The trail head starts here at the edge of the woods, close to Broken Land Parkway.  This is where we will meet.  Please take your dog out and show him around so others will know they're in the right spot :) There is a tunnel that leads under Broken Land Parkway so we won't have to walk the dogs through traffic.  (The parking lot at the main entrance of the lake is too small to acommodate us, so we don't use the main entrance to the lake.)


SAFETY/COURTESY

 Please allow yourself time to arrive a few minutes BEFORE  the walk begins to allow the dogs to sniff each other and form their pack.  We will step off on time. We will turn right (counterclockwise) at the lake, so if you are late, and can run to catch us, turn right.  (Otherwise, if you're really late, turn left so you will run into us at some point and we can all walk together.)  If you cannot make it please change your RSVP in a timely manner, or leave a note in the comments section.  


• Six foot length fixed leashes are required for your dog. 

• If we stay over to the RIGHT we can avoid the runners and bikers.  Also, if you see a BIKE or a RUNNER coming towards us from either direction, please yell out "BIKE!" or "RUNNER!" or "ON YOUR LEFT!" so we can get our dogs safely to the RIGHT side to avoid them.  Everyone else please echo the warning so the whole group hears it. (Especially important for dogs who like to leap toward runners or bikers.) 


• Please bring water for your dog and yourself.


Please read all the points below:


Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for friendly people with FRIENDLY DOGS (please, no snarling, growling, lunging or snapping dogs) to meet people with similar interests on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that:

•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests. 

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a leash (Fixed Length, non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)

Looking forward to seeing you and your doggies there!

                                                         Photos by J. Ameen-Lee

results.description:
We’re very excited about this great Meetup we have planned for you!

We've explored this popular topic before and we're really getting a handle on it.  Your organizers have carefully selected three short videos that complement each other and will stimulate great discussion on emotional eating (and healthy food). We believe they convey critical concepts to inspire you and allow you to get to the next level. If you go to only one event this month . . . . . . you should get out more often! ☺ (And you should go to THIS one).

We’ve edited the videos to show you the best parts in the shortest amount of time.

The first short video is an interview with psychologist Roger Gould Ph.D., one of the most prominent authorities on emotional eating. He shares the practical solutions that he’s developed throughout his career.

Next is well-known psychologist Douglas Lisle Ph.D., co-author of ‘The Pleasure Trap.’ (We have already shown a presentation by his co-author, Dr. Alan Goldhamer). He addresses psychological factors but emphasizes the role of unprocessed plant-based food, which currently makes up about 7% of the American diet.

Lastly, to break the tie, is an interview with Chef AJ who shares a lot of wisdom in her high energy style. She is a recovering food addict and points out that most people need to address emotional eating AND “getting the food right.” i.e., you have to do both.

In total there is about 40 minutes of video to stimulate the discussion, leaving plenty of time for sharing our own challenges and solutions. People find this kind of sharing to be extremely helpful, and there will be plenty of specific ideas and suggestions. There will also be plenty of awesome food - with recipes!

Your four organizers, Joe, Vlad, Emily and Jamila, will be on hand to help and advise you during and after this meeting. Vlad and Jamila are experienced and inspiring coaches. Joe is an M.D. and Emily is an R.D. (Registered Dietitian). We're not looking for paying clients. In fact, Joe and Emily don't accept paying clients. We just want to help, as volunteers.

Please bring a dish that is vegan (no dairy, egg, fish or meat of any kind), and not too much, if any, SOS (salt, oil, sugar).
It's not mandatory to bring food, but please try to bring something to share that fits these criteria, so that we don't run short.

You can get some ideas at www.NutritionAsMedicine.org.

If no time to cook, you can just bring some fruit, etc. If you're not in a position to bring anything for some reason, that's OK, just bring yourself (and friends).

And if you're new to all of this, you're especially welcome.

If you are bringing a dish, PLEASE bring a piece of paper with your name, the name of the dish AND INGREDIENTS (or recipe, even better, but at least ingredients - for those who are food-sensitive or following certain diets). Your name, and name of the dish, is so people can ask you for the recipe.

We raffle off great kitchen items each time; no cost to participate.  The raffle is open to anyone who is attending their first, second or third Meetup here, AND ALSO to anyone who has brought food with a list of ingredients, or the recipe.

If anyone has questions or wants to chat, please call Joe Adams M.D. at[masked] if you're not sure this is right for you, or if you're looking for a little help on how to break out of whatever barriers you might be facing.

Please join the free, twice-monthly conference calls for extra support and information, with some of the organizers and other participants. They’re always on the Third Thursday and First Tuesday of each month, at 7:30 pm.  The dial-in number is always:[masked], and the access code is always[masked]#. These calls are listed as ‘Upcoming Meetups’ - Please RSVP (if you can) in the Upcoming Meetups section: http://www.meetup.com/Baltimore-Nutrition-As-Medicine-Potluck/?scroll=true

There’s also a buddy system where we facilitate getting in touch with one another, and also one-on-one support provided by the volunteer organizers.

Enjoy this exciting journey, share your challenges or successes with others, and discover new foods often.

We can't wait to see you there! - Joe, Vlad, Emily and Jamila, the Nutrition As Medicine team.
results.name: Emotional Eating - Revisited!

results.description:
Of all the instruments used in sound healing, the Gong is perhaps the most powerful, and the most mysterious. Used in ancient Chinese palaces and temples, and also in the tradition of Kundalini Yoga, Gong Meditations, also called Gong Baths, are deeply nourishing and restorative. Similar to an extended savasana, the softer sounds are soothing on a deep level, and as the sound level builds, the body and energy are cleared in profound ways. Through the intense vibrations of the sound, the body and mind are able to relax and surrender to the healing energies of the Gong, and as the waves of sound wash over participants, a deep energetic clearing occurs, leaving the participant feeling balanced, peaceful, and light. Class led by Angela Blueskies.

Angela Blueskies is a Songkeeper, sound healer, and medicine woman. A lifelong musician, she received her training as a classical flutist at the prestigious Peabody Institute in Baltimore. In her performing career, she began to long for a deeper sense of connection and presence with her audiences. It was while travelling in South America that Angela first encountered traditions that worked with songs and music for healing and transformation. Deeply influenced by sacred ceremonies from Peru and the traditions of bhakti yoga and kirtan, she began to experiment with creating music for healing and meditation. Expanding beyond her background as a classical flutist, in her sound healing sessions, Angela also works with voice, toning, and mantra, as well as frame drum, rattles, flutes from around the world, singing bowls, and the gong. Her Sound Medicine Journeys are intuitively guided energy healing sessions that use song, music, and sound to bring clearing, balancing, and a higher vibration of peace and joy to all those present. In addition to her work with Sound Medicine Journeys, she also leads kirtan with several wonderful musicians in the Baltimore/Washington area, including her band Bhakti Tree. For more information, calendar of events, and to hear a selection of her music, please visit Angela’s website: www.angelablueskies.com

Website: http://angelablueskies.com/sound-healing/gong-bath-meditation/

Investment: $20
Please pay in advance so we can start on time.  You can pay using this link: (Scroll down until you see Angela Blueskies: Gong meditation).
http://nourishing-journey.com/journey/event-registration/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the Dunkin Donuts parking lot
results.name: Gong Medicine Journeys with Angela Blueskies

results.description:
Annapolis Tango is honored and proud to host MONICA PAZ, an Buenos Aires native and Master Teacher of Milonguero Style (Social) Tango 


'ABRAZO MILONGUERO': Milonguero is always Close Embrace but Close Embrace is not always Milonguero” 

Please read her extensive biography under SPECIAL EVENTS, schedule and register on Annapolis Tango  


~ schedule ~

FRIDAY 8th

BEG. LEVEL, 7 – 8:30pm

Tango is a Conversation 

Like a language, knowing a few keywords and phrases will enable you to keep the conversation flowing with your partner. Explore these elements and express them through your intention and steps in the language that is social Tango.


SATURDAY April 9th

ALL LEVELS, 12 – 1:30pm

Fine-tuning the Fundamentals, Milonguero style

How to train your body to get the most out of Tango. Fine-tune your balance and focus your movements while strengthening the connection with your partner. Play with the energy of your steps to reflect the music. 


ALL LEVELS 1:45 – 3:15pm

Milonguero: Much More than Close Embrace

The Milonguero embrace is the ultimate connection in tango. Understand the nuances and learn to adjust your position and axis to achieve a comfortable and dreamy embrace while dancing.

ALL LEVELS, 3:30 – 5pm

Dancing Small and Loving It

Ever been frustrated by a crowded dance floor? Explore the many ways milongueros navigate the floor to avoid collisions, deal with traffic jams, and change directions “arrepentidas” in a minimal amount of space and on short notice.


SATURDAY NIGHT, April 9th

Pre-Milonga Class with MONICA PAZ 8pm – 9pm

MILONGA 9pm until you drop! 

Cabeceos will be encouraged!

SUNDAY April 10th

INT-ADV. LEVELS, 12 – 1:30pm

It’s Not What You Do, but How You Do It

What did Carlos Gavito mean when he said: "Tango happens between the steps." Leaders and followers will explore the subtleties of that “in between” and move with confidence without “breaking the dream." 


INT-ADV. LEVELS, 1:45 – 3:15pm

Milonguero Turns

Execute the smoothest turns in all directions, while maintaining a close and comfortable connection with your partner throughout. See how pivoting, dissociation, dynamism, and timing effect the way you turn.

ALL LEVELS, 3:30 – 5pm

Guided Practica with Etiquette

A Practica with Monica to help you apply what you have learned in navigation and etiquette. Dance as you would at a traditional milonga in Buenos Aires such as Cachirulo and El Beso.
results.name: Maestro MONICA PAZ, Argentine Tango Weekend Intensive

2) Breathology™ mini retreats (at Bon Secour)

3) Other classes


A thought provoking discussion on kids and spirituality. While many parents are finding their wings, kids are innately spiritual but they still need training and support. For Kids Sake! A spirituality conversation for both parent and child is a free gathering to discuss bringing spirituality for kids" courses to the DC area. We will discuss Spirituality for Kids International and Journey of Young Women.


Spirituality is linked to self-awareness, life purpose, wisdom, resilience, fulfillment, self esteem and so much more. Join us for the discussion.

BREATHOLOGY™ created by Ayo Handy-Kendy, is the art and science of breath awareness and the application of breathing techniques that enhance the Spirit, Mind and Body. For over a year, I've been adding level 1 to offerings. The time has come to determine what's next?  Join the discuss on how this may be a useful practice. Most importantly, let's plan our next meetup or mini retreat for the "spring".


Lastly, what else is on your mind? We will also check in on how Sodotutu can support you this Spring/Summer.

Looking forward to connecting/reconnecting!

results.description:
Ok, here is another fab trip into the highest, wildest place in the Mid-Atlantic Region and a mostly downhill backpacking trip to boot! We will start on top of Spruce Knob, the highest place in WV and walk a few miles out the ridge, then a couple miles down to Upper Seneca Creek Falls in one of the prettiest locations as well! Total elevation drop the first day is 1800' over about 5 1/2 miles. This is one of the prettiest campsites you will ever run across! The next day is a 5 mile walk up the valley for a total elevation gain of 500'. Seneca Creek is the quintessential mountain stream with many watefalls along the way. This is a great walk and a trip you will never forget. Pictures for those more visually oriented are here:

http://www.midatlantichikes.com/id146.html Maps are also included as well. I have done this trip since the 70's and I never get tired of it and I think you will agree with me after doing it! Please note this is as close to the "High Country" as you can get in the Midatlantic, so come prepared for wind and rain or do not come! That being said, this is one great trip even in the rain with views that make anything from Shenandoah NP seem like flatland! If you have not backpacked with me before, please contact me beforehand as I must be sure you are prepared...I have a group to look after! As always this trip is crossposted from Washington Backpackers Meetup Group, seeya there!
results.name: Spruce Knob/ Seneca Creek Backcountry Backpacking Trip

results.description:
The Maryland Food Bank needs an accurate estimate of how many people will be volunteering for this event, so please update your RSVP as soon as possible if you aren't able to make it to this event.

=======================================


IMPORTANT VOLUNTEER INFO:

Open-toe shoes are PROHIBITED at the warehouse.  Wear clothes that you don't mind getting dirty (which probably won't happen, but it's a possibility).

Please arrive to the warehouse ON TIME.  We can't begin until EVERYONE is at the warehouse.

Additional volunteer info can be found at the MD Food Bank's website, at www.mdfoodbank.org.


=======================================

The Maryland Food Bank was founded in 1979 to coordinate the procurement and distribution of food donations from manufacturers, wholesalers, retailers and government agencies to organizations providing free food to the state's hungry.

Volunteers usually work on a high-tech conveyor belt in the warehouse, pulling specific types of food from the belt as they pass, and packing the sorted food into 25 - 50-pound boxes. Full boxes are then placed on the Maryland Food Bank's daily menu, available for more than 600 soup kitchens, pantries and shelters across the state to order.

results.description:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:

The blustery cold, windy, and wet weather forecast for Saturday would make walking over the Severn River a miserable experience, so I'm canceling the bridge walk. But we can still enjoy touring the USNC Museum at 11:30 am. Just ask where it is when you pass through the entrance gate. I'll meet you there!

In previous years, our group has enjoyed walking across the Severn River bridge to tour the Naval Academy grounds, St. Johns College, and the Maryland State House. We always get plenty of fresh air, some moderate exercise, and excellent views of the waterfront homes, boat traffic, and the Naval Academy playing fields and buildings. Our destination this time is the U.S. Naval Academy Museum and its impressive collection of historic exhibits. Afterward, we can stop for refreshments and food at Federal House Bar & Grille on Market Square before walking back across the bridge to our cars. 

Arrive on time for this event because we'll start walking at 10:00 am SHARP to reach the Naval Academy Museum by 11:30 am.

Meetup at Jonas Green Park 

We'll meet up at Jonas Green Park located at the foot of the Rt. 450 (Baltimore/Annapolis Blvd) bridge that crosses the Severn River to Annapolis. You can see the park down below as you approach the bridge on Rt. 450 heading toward Annapolis after taking Exit 27 from Rt. 50. To reach Jonas Green Park, turn left at the traffic light onto Baltimore Annapolis Blvd. just before the bridge.

The Google Meetup map above shows the address for the Severn Inn which is the best way to find our meetup spot. After turning left at the light, take the first right turn off Baltimore/Annapolis Blvd. that goes down to the Severn Inn and Jonas Green Park. You'll see the parking lot straight ahead as you go under the bridge. 

Parking is free, and there are restrooms at the park. If the Jonas Green lot fills up, you can try the nearby Severn Inn parking lot.

Walk Across the Severn River to Annapolis

From Jonas Green Park, our group will go up a short incline to the foot of the Rt. 450 bridge where we can use the sidewalk that crosses the Severn River. To the left are beautiful vistas of the Chesapeake Bay and the Naval Academy. To the right, there's a scenic view of the Severn River and the many lovely houses and boats along its shoreline.

Once we're on the Annapolis side, we'll continue walking on Baltimore/Annapolis Blvd. to King George St. that leads to the U.S. Naval Academy near City Dock. Our total roundtrip walking distance will be approximately 6-7 miles using the sidewalks. 

Touring the Naval Academy Museum


We're very fortunate that SHR member Andy Lyons has arranged for our group to receive a special guided tour of the Naval Academy Museum that will be conducted by Grant Walker (education director) and Andy himself (model ship builder). They will show us around and explain the many excellent exhibits telling the story of the U.S. Navy and naval warfare in general. In addition to its huge array of interesting and rare historical artifacts, the Museum displays an awesome collection of highly-detailed model ships that are accurate in every detail. It's going to be a fascinating experience!

Entrance to the Naval Academy Museum is FREE. Full information about the Museum is available on its excellent website:


http://www.usna.edu/Museum/

To enter the Naval Academy, you will need to present a photo ID and go through a metal detector at Gate 1 where visitors enter the grounds. 

Following our Museum tour, we can stroll around the Academy grounds to see the beautiful buildings, monuments, and lovely location by Annapolis harbor.

Federal House Bar & Grille

When we leave the Naval Academy, it's just a short walk to the Federal House Bar & Grille. Federal House is a comfy restaurant with a roomy bar area, tasty food, and a large selection of beers that our group has enjoyed on several occasions. As a general rule, our SHR group prefers gathering in the bar area where we can freely mingle and get separate checks with no hassles about group ordering. We also receive much better service by ordering and paying directly at the bar.

Return to Jonas Green Park


After refreshing ourselves at the Federal House, we'll head back up King George St. and cross the Severn River to our starting point at Jonas Green Park using the same route. The walk back is about 2.5 miles.

Meetup Details


We'll need good walking weather for this event. A little rain won't stop us, but we won't go in miserable conditions. I'll post a notice here and send out an email by 8:00 am on Saturday morning if we need to change plans or cancel.

Call Jake at[masked] to find us. I can't always answer my phone at events, but you can try.

I hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking area at Jonas Green Park
results.name: Walk Across the Severn River to Tour the Naval Academy Museum

results.description:
Foundations in Botany, Wild Food, & Herbal Medicine


Spring Course begins April 9
**Applications Deadline is February 15**

This course fills up quickly. Please register early!
For full details visit: http://www.charmcityfarms.org/the-foragers-apprentice-spring-2016/

* * * * * * * * * *

If you’re reading this then you probably already like plants. But perhaps you also wonder how plants might help in this sometimes overwhelming world where it seems nearly all our food is awash in chemical toxins, deficient in nutrients, and generally grown with disrespect. Perhaps you also have concerns about what seems to be an avalanche of chronic medical conditions in our country, like diabetes, depression, auto-immune diseases, allergies, GI problems, and chronic fatigue, and seek answers beyond the pharmacy prescription. Perhaps you have concerns about how our communities can become more truly self-sufficient, and rather than simply sustainable, resilient and regenerative, and your own household less dependent upon purchased products and materials.
Perhaps you are also concerned about the daily loss of forests, streams, animals, insects, and plants that seems to be happening at an unimaginable rate everywhere in the world, just to keep our lights on and gas in our tanks. How can we find a way out of this tangle that, frankly, we rely on for almost all our needs? Can we transition, as individuals and communities, towards a more connected and harmonious way of life?

Questions so big require many ways. This is the plant way. If your heart pulls you to the forest and the sidewalk cracks, then this course can give you the traction to pursue that yearning in its many and diverse applications, and to begin a path of deep apprenticeship to nature itself, for the benefit of the healing of one’s self, one’s community, one’s home-land, and all inner and outer places.


Foundations in Botany & Plant Taxonomy
Keeping a Nature Journal
Identification & Harvesting of Wild Edible Plants
Cooking Wild Plants
Language of Field Guides
Fundamentals of Western Herbal Medicine
Drying & Preservation of Plant Material for Food & Medicine
Seasonal Observation for Harvest Inventory
Understanding Ecosystems
Indigenous Cultivation Techniques (Intro to Ethnobotany)
When Harvesting Ethics Becomes Ecosystem Participation
Integrating Wild Plants into the Home Garden, Farm, or Food Forest
Making Simple Medicines
Intro to Mushrooms
First Aid & Hygiene Using Plants
Plants as Material: Fiber, Dye, Fire, Vessels, Tools
Sensory Exercises & Nature Grounded Meditation
results.name: The Forager's Apprentice Course- Spring 2016

results.description:
In the late 19th century, an overzealous publicity agent developed a trade show exhibit for a major American railroad headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland. This exhibit survived the railroad that sponsored it and grew to become a "national treasure" of railroad artifacts. Today, it comprises the collection of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Museum, the oldest, most comprehensive American railroad collection in the world. Admission to the museum is $18, and there are several free parking lots and also on-street parking.

The main entrance is at W. Pratt St and S. Poppleton St. entrance. 

http://www.borail.org/default.aspx
results.name: Join Me To Shoot The B&O Railroad Museum In Baltimore!

Participants will be introduced to tools to chart a new course to healthier, happier, stress-free living.

results.description:
We are returning to Unpub this year.  What is Unpub.  It is a convention for Game Designers and their unpublished board and card games.  They will be playtesting these games and looking for honest feedback about them (what works, what doesn't suggestions, etc.).  They welcome any feedback--don't feel like you have to be an expert.  The majority of the games I would class as on the strategy side with about 10-15% similar to games you might see at a typical AABM meetup.  Since they will have about 100 games being testes, that leaves you with 10-15 games in which you might be interested.

I have listed this event for 10AM.  The playtesting hours on Saturday are from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM.  Your are welcome to arrive after 10 AM.  However, the peak attendance at the convention last year was between about 12:30 and 6:00 PM.  Before that we were able to go from game to game at will.  After that we sometimes had to wait to try a game.  General admission tickets and can be acquired at unpub6.unpub.net.  Your ticket will also get you into the the second day of the convention on Sunday if you are interested in still more playtesting.

If you try a game or games that you really think would be a good fit for the group, ask the designer what there publishing plans are.  We may be able to purchase some of these games on Kickstarter or from the manufacturer when they are released.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be near the check-in desk of the Convention Center just before and after 10 AM.

results.description:
In the late 19th century, an overzealous publicity agent developed a trade show exhibit for a major American railroad headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland. This exhibit survived the railroad that sponsored it and grew to become a "national treasure" of railroad artifacts. Today, it comprises the collection of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Museum, the oldest, most comprehensive American railroad collection in the world. 

Admission to the museum is $18, and there are several free parking lots and also on-street parking.

The main entrance is at W. Pratt St and S. Poppleton St. entrance. 

http://www.borail.org/default.aspx
results.name: Join Me To Shoot The B&O Railroad Museum In Baltimore!

Hi, 

I'm Tony Wai, a veteran stock market investor for over 30 years.  I just took over as co-organizer for this group, delegated by Audrey, as she is in the process of transferring out of this area.  First let me thank Audrey for taking up the leadership and brought this group together in the past years.

I'd like to start the next meet up by gathering what our members are expecting from the activities, and then identify a few leaders to help me make that happen.  If you are interested in taking a leader/moderator role, please make sure you join this session.  I'll train you to be a good group moderator.  

This session will be limited to 8 (due to room size), interested meet up leaders are invited

We'll also discussion 1 more interesting topic:

What's the stock market trend looks like in the 2nd quarter and rest of the year, given the current global and domestic economic conditions and presidential election year

Subsequently, I'm planning to start a series of learning meetups, including the basic of investment psychology/mindset, CANSLIM fundamentals, efficient use of IBD resources, etc.  Your input will help me to shape what's more to come.

I'm a management consultant and executive coach, as well as president for a non-profit professional association.  I always believe enabling and helping others.  Let's do this together.

Tony Wai

Welcome to Warrior Meditation! These meditation sessions are secular and available to anyone wishing to meditate. All experience levels are welcome. During this session, I'll be offering 4 rounds of 10 to 15 minutes of Shamatha Meditation (also known as Calm Abiding, or Mindfulness meditation). If you are new to meditation and you would like to discuss the technique one on one, please send me a message, and we can schedule time before meditation to go over the technique. After the meditation session we discuss the meditation experience, and also take in select readings from a variety of meditation masters. The focus on most of our reading sessions is about using what we learn in meditation in every day life situations. 

Cheers!

Terri

"Our Time To Lead" a Women's Day celebration

11.00 am Registration

11.30 am Opening 

11.45 am Keynote Speaker 

Emily Rasowsky, Founder and CEO of All Women in Tech and Director of Marketing Strategy for Social Driver 

Hacking the Definition of 'Women in Tech' 

Have you Googled 'Women in Tech' lately? The results you get aren't so great. We all know this. We've heard this hundreds of time. So why aren't we seeing more movement? Why do we still fall short, even when we try our damnedest to be inclusive. This talk will begin to challenge our definition of 'women in tech' and begin to unpack where we all hold unconscious biases that lead to lack of diversity. We will look at not just the statistics around women in tech but what we can all do to help improve diversity and inclusion of other women at every level of the 'tech world'.  You'll walk away with clear steps on how you can personally move the meter around making a difference for all women in tech.  

12.30 pm Lunch

01.00 pm Network interactive

Four Best Practices to Achieving your Goals Through Networking ~ Join us for this hands on, information rich workshop where we will explore and practice the essentials of effective networking.  From a "pre game" plan to your post event follow up these tools are guaranteed to put you on the path to success, providing you with the magic you need to mingle with the best of them!

http://www.lisastearns.com/Welcome.html

Questions and Answers 

"So you want to work here ?"

Leslie Albrecht Director of Operations Social Driver

results.description:
Want to rehab houses? Already done a few flips?  Tap the hard-earned knowledge of two veteran rehabbers at the next: Strategies South Meeting  

 Special presentation by Chuck Edwards and David Page, instructors of the “

Rehabbing for Big Rewards”

 class later this month (with $100 savings now). An ideal meeting for our friends to the south of Baltimore — no more fighting Beltway traffic! Join us from points north, too. At Timbuktu restaurant in Hanover on Saturday, April 9, from 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Just $25 for Baltimore REIA members and $44 for non-members. Includes lunch! Sign up now (see below) and lock in your place.  You’ve seen the house flipping shows, and you’ve heard the radio ads from gurus who come into town and promise the world.  Here’s a better idea: learn about rehabbing from guys who are doing it right here, right now. Veteran rehabbers Chuck Edwards and David Page will share tips and techniques they’ve learned from years of rehabbing. You’ll explore: To rehab or not to rehab? Get a quick overview of the rewards ($$$), risks, and required skills.


 Oops, there it is! Chuck and David will share their mistakes so you can avoid ’em. (This part alone could save you thousands.)


 Rules of thumb. The 65% rule, the 50% rule, the $100k rule, and the bladder relief rule. 


 Love stories. How to get buyers to fall in love with your house (instead of somebody else’s).


 Mastering the baths. How master baths differ from main baths… tub vs. shower… sexy sinks.Quick tips. On hardwood flooring… electric panel boxes… rheostats (what the heck are those?)… bi-fold doors, and more. PLUS: plenty of time for Q&A. Bring your toughest questions about rehabbing and get the answers from Chuck and David. Don’t miss this opportunity! About Chuck and David: Together they’ve rehabbed more than 100 houses throughout the Baltimore metro area and beyond. Their “Rehabbing for Big Rewards” class includes a full day in the classroom plus an afternoon of property visits. 

Check it out, sign up early, and save $100.

 Sign up now for the


Strategies South meeting. The price includes your meal, with several choices of entrees, plus soft drinks, tax, and tip.  (Bar drinks are extra.)  Yes, you can pay at the door, but why not spend less time in line and more time networking? 

</a> <a href="http://www.secureinfossl.com/carts/shopping_cart/oneClickProductBuy/d24f04b8eaed2d16a5245bf151382bfb/0">

</a> <a href="http://www.secureinfossl.com/carts/shopping_cart/oneClickProductBuy/62ccc8f8fbb3fedf90fac36ac872534d/0">

 Not a member?

Join Baltimore REIA now

. You’ll pay the lower price to attend this meeting, save on our other meetings, save on classes, and get vendor discounts including a 2% rebate from Home Depot.  Plus a FREE welcome kit with $197 worth of DVDs. About the Strategies South meeting One of several satellite meetings from Baltimore REIA, Strategies South typically brings you a presentation by one or more local experts.  You’ll learn plenty from other investors in the room as well. We started this meeting for the convenience of our friends to the south of Baltimore.  Thanks to the quality of the presentations, attendees come from far and wide, so arrive early and network.  You may even do a deal.  DATE AND AGENDA:  The meeting is from 11:00 to 1:30 p.m., usually on the second Saturday of the month.  The first half-hour you can order your food and beverage, and network with your fellow investors.  The presentation begins around 11:30, with time for Q&A.   LOCATION:

Let's attend this free event, which includes a talk by astronaut Mary Cleave! Note: space is limited, and pre-registration with Howard County is required. See link below for registration details.

Event page/registration information: https://apm.activecommunities.com/howardcounty/Activity_Search/astronauts-and-asteroids/55283

Details from website: Astronauts and Asteroids

7 yrs +/ April 9/ 2-4 PM/ Free, preregistration required
Join us on this exciting afternoon to explore both the mysteries of asteroids and the oddities of life as an astronaut! Participants enjoy the full-dome films Astronaut and Impact! in out NatureSphere planetarium. Between films, participants enjoy presentations and Q&A sessions with a real astronaut and a scientist who studies asteroids. We're joined by former NASA astronaut Mary Cleave, who was part of the crew that deployed the Magellan-Venus exploration space craft, and by APL Planetary Scientist Andy Rivkin who was one of the scientists that first detected the presence of both water ice and organic materials on an asteroid's surface- shattering previous beliefs of asteroids as barren pieces of rock. Space is limited. Preregister to secure your spot. Thanks to our sponsors for making this program possible.
Info/Registration:[masked]

Price: Free
Ages: 7 and up
Gender: Coed

results.description:
The city of Kintargo has a new lord-mayor, but he's not someone interested in maintaining that city's free spirit. Paracount Barzillai Thrune has placed the city under martial law, and his cruel proclamations and sinister plans for the city bode ill. 

Can a small group of heroes and would-be rebels stand against the might of the Thrice-Damned House of Thrune and the Church of Asmodeus and save their home town from being crushed under the boot of an infernal tyrant? Will one of Cheliax's most powerful inquisitors make the city his playground, or can the rebels known as the Silver Ravens rise up to bring a new era of freedom to the so called Silver City of Kintargo? Join the rebellion! Save Kintargo! DOWN WITH THRUNE!

results.description:
Please join us for a the final lesson in the study on Pete Wilson's new book, "What Keeps You Up at Night: How to Find Peace While Chasing Your Dreams."

We will meet in Rooms 100/102 at Grace Baptist Church for a pot luck and Bible Study. (Please drive around to the back of the church and go in the door on the left-hand side as you face the church. The room is the first one on the left.)

EVERYONE NEEDS TO BRING A DISH TO SHARE. Please indicate what you will bring when you RSVP. Many thanks for doing this!


This is the last of six sessions. You can still join us even if you haven't come before!


Session 6: Living Your Adventure


Throughout this study, we've talked about the imperative of making sure God is at the center of our focus. He--not our dreams and not our fears--is the central character in our stories. To live in that reality, we must surrender certain things, and as Pete tells us this week, it's by surrendering that we find our greatest adventures! Please join us for this final session as we wrap up the series.


You won't want to miss this crucial lesson!


Each night's schedule (roughly):
6:00-7:00-pot luck dinner & fellowship
7-7:15- DVD video
7:15-8:00-Table discussions

To get the most out the study, you can order What Keeps You Up at Night from Amazon or your favorite book retailer. Also, there is a great little Bible Study book that goes along with it with compelling, deeper studies after our discussions. You can order the Bible Study book from Lifeway.

Of course, there is always the option of just coming and watching the 15-minute video and joining us for table discussion after our pot luck fellowship each night. Either way you choose to be part of the group, we are happy to have you join us!

Please note we do not provide child care.

If your plans change, please remember to go in and change your RSVP. Many thanks for this.

We usually have about 20-25 people each evening.


Hope you can join us!


Looking forward to seeing everyone!
results.how_to_find_us: Rooms 100/102
results.name: Pot Luck and Bible Study on "What Keeps You up at Night"

results.description:
April 9th is our 7th Birthday! Come on out and help us celebrate at Meadow's Frozen Custard in Columbia. We'll start off by hanging out and eating ice cream. Later, we'll put that sugar rush to good use with a night run through Howard and Montgomery county!

We will meet on the Giant grocery side of the shopping center, back away from the other cars.  We will the get ice cream, frozen custard etc and admire all the Minis.  When everyone is done we will have a short (about an hour) drive through some of the twisty roads nearby, returning to the shopping center at the end of the run.  This will be a short run because 1) it is in the evening and 2) we have quite a few people signed up.  Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Bring your prayers and intentions.  We encourage you to bring your drums or other percussion instruments.  If you don't have any, we have plenty to share. 

A drum circle is a fun experience that is accessible to anyone who wants to participate regardless of age or experience level. The goal is to achieve oneness with a group, not rhythmic perfection.  This is not a professional group, we do this for fun and release.  Children are welcome and I have purchased some instruments specifically for kids. 

Shamanism is the oldest spiritual belief system on earth. Drumming has been a method of group healing and achieving unity since the beginning of time. Studies have shown that drumming accelerates physical healing, boosts the immune system and produces feelings of well-being.

The drum circle will be held every 2nd Saturday of the month from 7:00 to 8:30. 

A $10 donation would be appreciated. No one will be turned away if finances are an issue. All are welcome.
results.how_to_find_us: Off of York Road in Timonium next to Nautilus Diner
results.name: Shamanic Drum Circle of Timonium

results.description:
You can look up Stephen Lay Band on Youtube or Google. An amazing musical talent, classically trained and steeped in rich musical traditions, Stephen is, first and foremost, an entertainer.  Don’t miss this performance of some of his favorite Elton John classics and Billy Joel deep cuts.  Spiritual and Christian themes and just plain fun ones, too.

The venue is the lower level (with a fireplace) of an old stone church, very close (a stone's throw away!) from Columbia Mall.  Warm, intimate setting with about 200 people max at round tables with 8 people to a table. 

To join us, go to 2nd Saturday Cafe and reserve and pay for your spot ($25) online for table 17, if there is still a place available. Not exaggerating--almost all of the seats have been taken.

This event includes a buffet of appetizers and sodas and coffee and tea, as well as entertainment. Wine is $3 per glass. Food and drink have been donated, so ALL of your $25 will be a donation to Agape House, a charity in Baltimore City that has a focus on after school tutoring programs for City kids, particularly those with incarcerated parents. So come have fun and fellowship for a good cause!

Pay online so that you can secure your seat. Note: no seats are sold at the door, and they are going quickly!
results.how_to_find_us: Table 17--Reserve (and pay for) your place at the table while there are seats!
results.name: 2nd Saturday Cafe: Stephen Lay Band and Appetizers

results.description:
UPDATE #2: The Fox's Den (http://foxsden.com/) is a very small walk away from Castlebay.  It also has an extensive craft beer list.  Another consideration...


=====================


UPDATE:


Parking for Ram's Head is available at Gott's Garage (for a fee), or you can take your chances and park down one of the side streets near the brewpub.

Two more possible stops are Castlebay and Galway Bay, which are within easy walking distance of the Ram's Head and the Reynolds Tavern basement pub (1747 Pub).  From there, let's walk back to Gott's Garage and drive to Heroes Pub, which is about 5 minutes away.  They have an extensive beer list.

Or, we can skip a few of the places, though I would like to try Heroes.  Let's make it a game-time decision.

=====================


Let's explore the pubs and taverns in Maryland's capital city. Meet me at the Ram's Head Tavern, and from there we can explore other places, like the basement bar at Reynold's Tavern. More pubs/taverns will be added later.

I'm listing this meetup as lasting four hours, but 11pm is not a set end time. Come whenever you can, and contact me via Meetup once you're in the area so I can let you know where we are. Cheers!
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.ramsheadtavern.com/annapolis/
results.name: Annapolis pub/tavern crawl

results.description:
Spring has sprung! Beethoven’s Ode to Joy is one of the most spectacular works ever written for orchestra and chorus. A stunning text celebrating the shared brotherhood of all humanity comes together with exciting and moving music to make this piece a truly one of a kind work.  This was also the celebration symphony that was conducted by Leonard Bernstein and played in Berlin in 1989 when the Berlin Wall came down.  Here's a video of that event.

For one night only, the Annapolis Chorale, Annapolis Chamber Orchestra and guest soloists will fill the stage and the hall with JOY!

Tickets can be purchase here before you RSVP.
results.name: Classical Music: Beethoven's "Ode to Joy"

results.description:
Update 04/05/2016:

50 degrees and sunny is the forecast today for Sunday! :)


Update 03/12/2016: 

Well they are calling for rain on Sunday for this workshop, so I will reschedule this until Sunday April 10th!

FYI: We chatted about doing lunch in between Part I and Part II Saturday. You can bring a lunch, or we can find a spot in Fells Point as well, or do carry out and meet on the pier area. Lots of options.  

We wanted to start a series for B&W photography lovers, Film or Digital shooters of all levels.

This series will have two parts to it, street photography and studio glamour or portrait photography. Both with the "One Roll" challenge associated with it. (Digital DSLR shooters will be limited to 24 total shots for each part.)

Shooting film is a beautiful creative option, but an unforgiving experience too. It's where your camera mechanics,  understanding of light, exposure, and subject interests has to be right. Or you have just wasted $30 + dollars on that one roll just to see you messed up. Not funny really.

Add the one roll challenge (12 frames for 220, or 24 frames, 35mm) and now you are forced to spend more time selecting the shot of interest, once you find it! I've seen experienced shooters take all day on a one roll challenge.

Part One: (8am - 11am.) We will meet and shoot in historic Fells Point Baltimore for the street photography portion. Please note we are meeting in front of Bond Street Social, 901 S Bond St, Baltimore, MD 21231.  

Part Two: (2pm - 5pm.) Studio portraits with another "one roll" with the beautiful DMV model Brianna, plus other models back at our Skyloft F Rental Studio, 3701 Bank Street, Baltimore, MD.

After we get our film developed and scanned, load two of your favorite shots in this meetup gallery and share what made it your favorite? 

FYI: We use The Darkroom to develop and scan our 120 rolls, mailed in. While some folks use local Dodge-Chrome, we can compare these two as well. 


So join us for one part, or both parts which ever interest and time allows. But challenge yourself in 2016!
results.how_to_find_us: Call or Text Jeff: 410-733-2219
results.name: Black and White Photography: Film and Digital

Enjoy a class focused on finding comfort in your changing body, and preparing for labor and birth. Students will practice breathing exercises and gentle yoga postures. Perfect for beginning students, or the experienced yogi looking to modify her practice for pregnancy. 

This class is free, with no obligation to register. Starting with class next week, it's $18 to drop in for one class, or you can sign up for less than the full session by paying $16 x the number of classes.

results.description:
Summary: 4.8 mile sort of figure 8 looping trail run from CCBC parking lot to Patapsco River & back.


First things first.  For safety reasons, we need two members to guide this run - one in the front and one in the back.  Also we need at least three members total counting the front and back guides.  I'll be the guide in the back.

Want to try out trail running without the pressure of having to keep a certain pace??  Or just want a casual paced run/walk combo in the woods??  (The faster runners can run several loops as desired.) Come on out and join us! 


At least one member and probably others will keep a sufficiently slow pace running, walking and resting as necessary so that no one is left behind. (We mean that!).

These trails are technical and challenging with several steep climbs, rocks, roots, loose dirt, and uneven surfaces.  To make up for all of the hard stuff, there is also a good amount of flat and downhill sections.  We’ll also be sharing the trails with mountain bikers, hikers, and other runners.  

The distance is about 4.8 miles total.  Time will be around an hour and 15 minutes.

Trail Description:

The trails consist of two loops (sort of a figure eight but not really).  There are several hills and climbs, creek crossings, and a bit of asphalt running. Most of the trail is wooded. There will be some water crossing, dirt and muddy areas, rocks, and sticks...so please wear shoes you don't mind getting dirty or wet.  The smaller loop which is about a mile can be run one or more extra times to add on additional miles.


Parking:

Parking is available in lot 6 by the tennis courts at CCBC.  Look for the group of runners.

Maps and Apps:


To get to know the trails ahead of time, check out the following maps and apps.


http://www.gpsies.com/map.do?fileId=mnfvukxascjdfgyi

Trail Pictures:

Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: We will gather at the trail head by the tennis courts at Community College of Baltimore County (CCBC, Catonsville)
results.name: Any/All Pace Trail Run- Patapsco Santee, Vineyard & Nun's Trails- Catonsville

results.description:
**THIS CLASS IF FULL. PLEASE LOOK TO FUTURE SCHEDULED CLASSES THIS YEAR! **
http://www.charmcityfarms.org/homeskills/


**For full details & to register visit: http://www.charmcityfarms.org/early-spring-foraging-immersion-2/ **

What if you could look out onto any landscape and see food and medicine everywhere? It’s possible! In fact, it’s the birthright of every human being on Earth.

Take it one step further from plant walks and your field guide, and immerse yourself in a day of hands-on learning, foraging for edible and medicinal plants in early Spring.

We’ll apply simple learning in botany, harvesting methods & ethics, and plant processing and cooking, to the task of making lunch from what is growing in the immediate landscape. Participants will have plenty of opportunity for individual attention and questions, and possibly for seeking out particular plants of interest.

This class is great for total beginners or for more experienced students of nature seeking to fill in some gaps in their experience. Expect to be spending the whole day outdoors, gathering baskets of greens, digging and scrubbing roots, and cooking and preparing our harvest. Please dress for the weather, and bring some water.

Lunch is potluck style, and participants will be given recommendations of what to bring to compliment the plants we harvest, such as fresh bread, cheeses, hummus, salad dressing, etc.

Participants are welcome to bring notebooks or cameras to record their learning, and will be encouraged to take some of the wild plants we gather home to practice cooking them again for dinner.

**This class is limited to 10 participants.

When: Sunday, April 10th @ 10am- 4pm 

Cost: $40

Where: Hateful Acres, Freeland MD 

Instructor: Victoria Greba

**For full details & to register visit: http://www.charmcityfarms.org/early-spring-foraging-immersion-2/ **

results.description:
One of the best kept secrets here just north of Towson is the public access to a "protected" area of Loch Raven Reservoir park on the weekend.  On both Saturday and Sunday, park police close off Loch Raven Drive (some maps call it Loch Raven Rd.) between Morgan Mill Road and Providence Road. The road becomes a recreational area for walking, running, biking, and the like.  In the warmer months, many people picnic or just relax on blankets and chairs along the water.  The views of the water and the surrounding wooded areas are wonderful all year round.

It is an "out and back" hike, can't possibly get lost, bite off as much as you want to chew.

The total distance is approximately 3 and 1/2 miles which we complete in roughly 1 hour, so that you can probably be home before noon, if you want to. But also feel free to stay as long as you like.

 Loch Raven is city reservoir property. It, technically, is not a park at all. In other words, no potty facilities, no pavilions, etc. What you see is what you get. So......take care of business before you get there.

To get there, if you are travelling north on Dulaney Valley Rd. from the Beltway, the road splits just after crossing a large bridge over the lake. Dulaney Valley Rd. is the one that continues to the right toward the east. That's what you want. Don't go up the hill which is Jarrettsville Pike.

Travel on Dulaney Valley Road for roughly another mile or so. You will enter the park from the north. To do so, you bear right/make a right hand turn from Dulaney Valley Rd onto Loch Raven Drive at the corner where Peerce's Plantation/Landing/Grille (the name depends on who owns it this week; it's had some turnover in recent years) is located.  Peerce's address is 12460 Dulaney Valley Road 21131. If your GPS is telling you to go farther north on Dulaney Valley Rd past Peerce's, it's just plain wrong !!! Once you enter the park, the meeting place is about a mile down the road.

This hike will begin at the road closure gate at the corner of Loch Raven Drive and Morgan Mill Road. Parking is allowed on the west side of Loch Raven Drive and there is a sort of a parking lot on Morgan Mill Road.

When you see this sign, you've found the right place.  We'll meet right behind it, by where you see the guy/rock. 

Loch Raven Drive is a normal, well paved road, so there is no need for "off road" footwear unless you choose to get adventurous and challenge the rather steep hills that surround the lake.  That is certainly an option for those who are more experienced and confident.  However, I am not aware of any sanctioned, prepared trails in that area of Loch Raven and can't recommend it.  It would be free style.

I will not post cancellations because of the weather. I assume we're all capable of making that decision as each of us sees fit.

If you decide to respond "Yes" to this event and later change your mind for whatever reason, please,please go in and change your RSVP to a "No". That way, we know not to be waiting for you. Thanks.

So come join us on Sunday for a brisk walk in the park. It's a great way to clean out the cobwebs and start a Sunday.
results.how_to_find_us: Please read the directions below carefully. We do NOT meet at Peerce's. That's just a landmark along the way.

Description: We often take the world for granted, checking off the mundane tasks of our “to do list” without looking up towards broader horizons and open skies. Exclusively focusing on the practical, one can lose touch with the awe, mystery and wonder that we felt as a child. In the words of John Stuart Mill, “It is not understanding that destroys wonder, it is familiarity.” How can we keep the unfamiliar in our lives? What is “wonder” and how can it help inspire us to live more fully?

Speaker Bio: Hugh Taft-Morales joined the Baltimore Ethical Society as its professional leader in 2010, the same year he was certified by the American Ethical Union as an Ethical Culture Leader. He also serves as Leader of the Ethical Humanist Society of Philadelphia. His presence in Ethical Culture has been termed “invigorating.” Taft-Morales lives in Takoma Park, Maryland, with his wife Maureen, a Latin American Analyst with the Congressional Research Service, with whom he has three beloved children, Sean, Maya, and Justin.

For more information on the Baltimore ethical society:

Website: bmorethical.org

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/bmorethical

results.description:
On the water time will be 11 a.m. sharp! Please plan to be there at least by 10:30. We will not wait for you! Gregg[masked]

For Advanced Beginners : This event is for those who have been on longer trips (up to 10 miles, full day outings), have some experience with Level 2 conditions (Protected water near shore, up to 10 Knot winds, up to 1 foot waves, up to 1 knot currents) , winds, waves and currents, and have good rescue and group-paddling skills.

Leisurely paced ~ 10 mile paddle in the past; multiple stops to explore and swim etc.

One of my favorite and most scenic paddle places, rated one of the top kayaking trips in our part of the country. See past pictures from our photo albums. Gigantic rocks and boulders. Lots of islands to explore and pull up to a sandy beach to go for a swim ( in the Summer !) . Surprising waterfalls coming down from the hills. Lots of eagles to watch fly over. Variety of water types. Bring your water and a lunch. A camera is also recommended. Bring a plastic boat there are some small rapids which you could find yourself over a rock or two.

Tasty informal meal nearby afterward optional, at the wonderful Peach Bottom Inn !

http://peachbottominn.com/

Stop by THE MOST FAMOUS kayak shop on the planet, StarrkMoon before or after. where i buy ALL my kayaks !

Leisurely paced ~ 10 mile paddle in the past; multiple stops to explore and swim etc.

Cold water gear will be REQUIRED ! Wetsuit at least (drysuit optional) , poagies for the hands etc. Bring a dry change of clothes in case of a capsize.

*********PLEASE review these excellent "cold water gear/ clothing " articles before paddling. ***********

http://www.paddling.net/guidelines/showArticle.html?95

http://www.paddleboston.com/advice/dressforcoldwater.php

"There are three rules to remember when dressing for cold weather:

No cotton.
It soaks up water and holds it against your skin, leaving it worthless as an insulator and heavy as a layer. A worthless, worthless fabric in the water.

Layers help trap heat and fend off water. Remember "wick, warmth, and weather" as you arrange your layers: light wicking fabrics first, then warm insulating sweaters or fleeces, and finally an waterproof outer layer to protect you from the elements.

No cotton; seriously."

Kayaking involves known and unanticipated risks which may include, but are not limited to, pain, suffering, physical injury, death and economic or emotional loss, which participants may suffer during, or travelling to and from this activity. By voluntarily participating in this activity, participants acknowledge these risks and agree to hold harmless WatersEdge Kayak Club Meetup Group and its Organizers and leaders against any and all claims, suits or actions of any kind for any damages, liabilities or compensation brought by the participant or anyone acting on behalf of the participant.

Participants must be responsible for their own safety and should educate themselves through instructional courses about safety, rescue techniques, navigation, and protection from the elements and weather (both hot and cold). Participants should stick with the group to enhance their own personal safety and follow instructions from the trip leaders. Following the above guidelines will help make kayaking the safe enjoyable outdoor endeavor it should be.

results.description:
Come and enjoy a nice, slow walk for your tiny, aged or slower walking doggy!  Regular pace dogs are also welcome to join the fun.


Sunday's high will be 49 degrees, 12 mph wind and sunny with no chance of rain.

Please look carefully at the instructions and map below to find out where to park and meet for the walk!

Lake Kittamaqundi, the downtown heart of Columbia. For many years, the path only went only part-way around the lake. But in the fall of 2014, the Columbia Association completed the circuit and we can now walk around the entire lake along a new paved path!

This walk is very flat, only one gentle hill, and 1.5 miles around. We'll pass by the People Tree, the lakefront stage, and long-established Columbia restaurants like Clyde's and Tomato Palace.


You will basically head for the new Whole Foods of Columbia (added in Fall 2014), across from the Columbia Mall. However, we will park and meet in the lower lot, down the hill, and to the right of Whole Foods (as you look at it from the front.) This is actually the parking lot for the new Haven on the Lake spa. Please park in the area furthest from the spa entrance, as shown on the map below, so that we are closest to the trail and won't get in the way of the spa clients.


SAFETY & COURTESY

Please arrive early, to allow the dogs time to sniff and form their pack. We will leave on time.  If you can't make it please change your RSVP promptly, or leave a comment.  We'll turn to the right on the trail (counter clockwise) so you'll know where to find us if you arrive late.  


Please bring water for yourself & your dogs.  We're trying to avoid sharing water on the trail to prevent the chance of spreading the New Dog Flu.


If you see joggers or bikers, please shout "ON YOUR LEFT" to keep the dogs safe from being trampled, and to protect others from tripping on our animals.

PLEASE READ:

Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for friendly people with friendly dogs to meet people with similar interests on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that: 

•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests. 

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a 6-foot fixed leash (non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)

 Looking forward to seeing everyone again!  


                                                                       Photos by J. Ameen-Lee

results.description:
A Short Paddle in Annapolis

Cold Water Gear is REQUIRED for this paddle.  If you don't know specifically what that means, learn more here:

http://www.meetup.com/Chesapeake-Kayak-Adventures/messages/boards/thread/38728872


The weather forecast for this weekend has been all over the place with different forecasts from different services.  Based on that I didn't think we wanted to paddle in 30 to 40 degree air temps and 20+ mile an hour winds with a little rain mixed in.  It's starting to look a lot more tolerable although one forecast still has it only getting into the 40's.  Anyway here's a relatively short paddle in Annapolis from the Truxtun Park boat ramp.

What I would really like to do if weather and water conditions permit is to paddle over to Jonas Green Park and stop for lunch.  Getting there involves either crossing the mouth of the Severn or going along the Naval Academy wall, both of which can get a little choppy and the water is still pretty cold in Annapolis.  Even with Cold Water Gear you may want to consider whether this is the right paddle for you.

If we make it to Jonas Green expect about 10+ miles. If we don't expect substantially less.  Pack a lunch for yourself and consider bringing a snack to share with the group.  Be sure to bring enough to drink to stay well hydrated.  As usual, the time posted is the on the water time.  Plan to arrive early enough to have your boat and gear ready to launch promptly by then.

Among other things we will get to see the burned out shell of the Annapolis Yact Club and the major renovations going on at Ego Alley.  We'll also take a detour up College Creek either coming or going.

There is one rental boat available for this paddle at the rate of $55.00 for the day. To request it you must have your own Cold Water Gear as defined in the link above.  Just send me a Meetup message if that's you.

Of course this gets us in the Annapolis area to attend the special EMS private sale event at 6:00 PM.  We'll probably gather at Gordon Biersch's which is just around the corner from EMS for a drink before attending the sale.
results.how_to_find_us: Best bet us to search for Truxton Park Boat Ramp on your GPS.  The address doesn't always work

results.description:
We would love to see you all for another awesome meetup to celebrate the much awaited arrival of Spring. We will hold the April meetup at Maryland City Dog Park on Sunday, April 10th at noon. 


So gather up your Bullies and put a spring in your pups step all the way to the park.  It is an incredible sight to behold a huge gathering of frolicking Bulldogs all showing off that famous happy mug.  It's at these meetups I am reminded of why I fell in love with this breed.  They truly have the best personalities and to see so many in one place just makes people happy. Come share in the contagious happiness of this awesome Bulldog social gathering.


MEETUP.COM INCREASES MEMBERSHIP DUES: 


Meetup has increased their dues beginning this month to $19.95 a month or if we prepay up front $180 yearly.  Because of the increase in fees, we need to emphasize that your financial support is really necessary and the only way to sustain the group. We have opted out of meetup.com's suggestion to to make Due's mandatory. We can’t thank you enough for your continued donations. This is such a worthwhile inexpensive investment in the happiness & socialization of your Bully. It is only possible through your support that we are able to continue this incredible group.

In order to make it easy for you to give we have several ways you can pay: 


1. Cash          2. Personal Checks          3. Credit or Debit Card

1. You can pay with cash at the meetup by dropping it in the donation box on the big sign or by giving it to Andrea or Christine personally.  

2.  You can pay with a personal check made payable to either Andrea Nicholson or Christine Hughes at the meetup.

3. You can pay by credit or debit card right here on the meetup.com website (just click on the green box located on the left hand side of your screen that says "Chip In" under Help Support Your Meetup). Please note for this method of payment they deduct 10% service fee.

TOY SWAP:
Remember we have the on-going toy swap a fun way to rotate those toys your Bully is bored with or just come help yourself to a new toy out of the box for your pup. There are always toys in the bin waiting for a new Bully to take one home. Just look for the Blue Toy Bin at the meetup.

results.description:
Vernal pools are special habitats, created by melting winter snow and spring rains. At this time of year, they are teeming with life - they become mating and breeding pools for just a few species of frogs and salamanders.  These amphibians leave their winter hibernation in the woodlands to find mates, lay their eggs, and have their young hatch and develop in this ephemeral, watery environment.

We know that not everyone can get to a vernal pool - so we’ll bring its animal inhabitants closer to you! Please join us to discover more, and see up close, the amphibians and reptiles of Maryland’s vernal pools at our Sunday, April 10 ‘Nature Connection’.


AGENDA:

1:15pm - Presentation by Mark Tegges “Vernal Pools and the Amphibians and Reptiles of Maryland That Need These ‘Pools of Life’ for Survival”

About Mark: He was born and raised in Baltimore Maryland and has been photographing Reptiles and Amphibians, and other wildlife since 1968. As a child growing-up on East Belvedere Ave, he would often ride his bicycle to Loch Raven or Herring Run Park to search for Herps.  He started photography with a black and white “swinger” camera his brother received for Christmas, then upgraded to a Kodak Instamatic! He attended Baltimore Polytechnic Institute where he joined the Herpetology Club, and purchased his first Canon 35mm camera. He graduated from Towson State University with a Biology degree, and continues to travel and photograph wildlife in their natural environment. He has been published in various wildlife magazines and posters.

2:30pm - Presentation by Heather Cunningham on the results of the MARA project, the Maryland Amphibian and Reptile Atlas, a state-wide, citizen science project aimed at documenting the current distribution of Maryland’s amphibian and reptile species.  MARA is a five-year, joint project of the Natural History Society of Maryland and Maryland Department of Natural Resources.

Ongoing from 1:00-4:00pm - Stop in anytime; stay as long as you’d like!

• See vernal pool amphibians up close! Depending on the hatching cycle, we may have egg masses, tadpoles, newts, wood frogs, and spotted salamanders.

• Enjoy amphibian-related crafts and activities for children

• Our presenters, Mark Tegges and Heather Cunningham, as well as scientists and naturalists from the Natural History Society will be on hand throughout the afternoon to answer questions and guide your explorations.

FREE ADMISSION / PRE-REGISTRATION IS NOT REQUIRED

Location:

Natural History Society of Maryland

6908 Belair Road

Baltimore, MD  21206

Located in Overlea, about one mile inside the Beltway, on Belair Road, across from St. Michaels church, at the flashing yellow traffic signal. About Nature Connections

Nature Connections are Sunday afternoon programs with fun, hands on activities and explorations to help you and your family connect with nature. Each event offers:

— themed activities tailored for children and families; these may include games, arts, crafts, stories, and even music and drama

— presentations, displays, and information from local experts and organizations

— specimens and artifacts from natural history collections

— live critters

— experienced professionals to answer questions and guide your discoveries of the natural world

results.description:
• A vision board is a poster collage that you create with pictures and words that visually represents your intentions and goals for the future.  

In this workshop, you will create your vision board and it will be energetically empowered to help your vision more rapidly manifest into real life.  With the combination of visioning and energetic work, this is a powerful workshop!  While individual results will always vary, prior participants in this workshop actually manifested a new Porsche Cayenne, a new sunroom and deck for her house, vacations, resuming hobbies and exercise, and more!

More specifically, in this workshop:

• We will discuss vision boards and how they help with manifesting the life of your dreams.  

• You will be led through a series of exercises to help you gain greater clarity on your hopes and dreams, and what you would most like to manifest in your life, including in the areas of career, relationships, family, love, health, wealth, home, travel, hobbies, and more.  

• You will have fun creating your vision board.  You will have ample time to get into the process and enjoy creating your personal vision board. You will be provided with materials, including poster board, markers, etc.  As one way to make your vision board more powerful, you will be shown how to lay it out following the Feng Shui bagua map, if you choose.  

• Quantum Meditation:  By the time you have completed your vision board, you will have greater clarity on what you want to achieve in different aspects of your life.  We will then spend the remainder of this workshop doing a quantum meditation.  This quantum meditation helps to bring your individual energetic frequency into alignment with the energetic frequency of the life that you wish to create.  As you sink into the quantum field of infinite possibilities during this meditation, you will also receive healing, and release inner blocks to manifesting the life you wish to create.  Doing this meditation in a group increases its power exponentially!  

• Each participant will also receive individual energetic processes, to help support each person individually in coming into alignment with their vision.  


This will be a VERY powerful, fun, and creative workshop that will help you set the stage for creating what you want in your life!  You will have the time, space, and support that you need to gain clarity on your hopes and dreams, you will do fun arts and crafts, and you will receive peaceful and healing energetic work.  You will thus leave this workshop feeling relaxed, uplifted, confident, and ready to move forward in a positive direction in your life.  

Investment:  $125

Pre-registration is required for this workshop. Because Taruna will be providing materials for creating vision boards in this workshop, she asks that you pre-register with her so she has an accurate count of the people attending.  Please contact Taruna at [masked] or[masked], to pre-register.  A minimum of 4 people is required to run this workshop.

Please bring the following to this workshop:·  A notebook

Please bring the following to this workshop:

Any snacks or drinks that you may like to have

Testimonials from prior participants:

“This powerful workshop merges personal development with fun activities. The different steps of clearing out the old, envisioning the new, creating it, and empowering it allow the participant to have a powerful experience. This is not the average vision board class. Taruna teaches in a way that is easy to follow and is able to personalize the workshop to allow each individual to have shifts in their energy that day. Long term it is the most powerful board I have ever created. The value for the price is a steal.”  - Kristen R.   

“I got so much out of doing this workshop. Not only do I have a vision board I love to look at, it really shows me a picture of how I am showing up in my life. Using the bagua squares helped me see the areas in my life where I am fully present and the ones I’m not or am resisting. I found Taruna to be a kind, patient, fun and focused leader.”  - Shirley B.  

----About Taruna:


Taruna is an energy healer and life purpose coach.  She has had a life-long interest in healing, and supporting clients in bringing greater peace, joy, and wellness into their lives.  This passion led her to complete certifications in numerous energy healing modalities, as well as a PhD in Clinical Psychology.  Taruna thus uses her unique combination of coaching, energy healing, and intuitive skills to help people achieve their personal life and career goals.  Taruna’s clients have reported improvements in many different physical, mental, and emotional challenges. She enjoys providing these services to adults and children, and she works with clients both in-person and distantly.  For more information about Taruna and her services, please see: http://wellnessfromwithin.center/

Taruna works with the following energy healing modalities:  Reiki (Usui and Karuna Reiki® Master); Reconnective Healing; Arcturian Healing Method; Ama~Deus (Level 3 Practitioner); Holistic Metamorphosis® (Level 3); Pranic Healing®; Triple Action Life Force Healing; Access Consciousness Bars; Bioridian Healing.

results.description:
When devils slay the knightly leader of Arwyll Stead and orcs from the Hell's Fury tribe attack the town, all hope seems lost for the brave people living on Lastwall's border. The coincidental arrival of the mysterious half-orc Vegazi also raises unsettling questions, and it's up to the heroes to make sense of these events and end the Hell's Fury tribe's threat to Arwyll Stead once and for all. What does Vegazi have to do with the raiders' diabolical plot? Who will rally Arwyll Stead now that the town's icon has been cut down? And who is the mastermind orchestrating the orc tribe's alliance with devils from beyond?

Daughters of Fury is a deluxe adventure for 3rd-level characters, and includes 64 action-packed pages of exciting battles, enticing social encounters, and new monstrous foes, plus a gorgeous double-sided poster map featuring an overview of Arwyll Stead and a miniatures-scale battlemap! The author of this adventure, Victoria Jaczko, was the winner of the 2014 RPG Superstar contest, in which hundreds of unpublished authors compete for the chance to write a Pathfinder Module, and in addition to her adventure, this book contains a host of new monsters and magic items designed by the contest's runners-up.

Players can expect to reach 6th level upon completion of this adventure—if they can survive the onslaught of hell-tainted orcs and deadly devils!

---------

Details- Make a 20 point buy character 3rd level PC - Paizo books (no evil races (ie grippli, aasimar, ifrit, etc OK), no non PFS approved stuff (ie no APG summoner). Ultimate Intrigue ok. 3000 gp in equipment. No arguments about what is and isn't OK please.

First PFS chronicle for 2nd-4th level PCs

Length: 9 miles, Configuration 2 loops with an extended spur, Difficulty: Moderate, Scenery: Loch Raven Reservoir, upland forest, Exposure: Shade, Hiking Time: 3-3.5 hrs.

There are several hills on this hike and a couple of streams to cross.  But most of the hike follows along the reservoir and is fairly flat.

Directions: Take I-695 to Exit 27, Dulaney Valley Road north. Go five blocks and turn left onto Seminary Avenue (after Meadowcroft Lane); park immediately on the right shoulder in front of the Church of Latter-Day Saints. Carefully cross Dulaney Valley Road and pick up the dirt path paralleling Seminary Avenue and then quickly ducks back into the woods on the left. Two orange posts strung with a steel cable mark the trailhead.

We will me at the trailhead at 1:30 p.m. and leave for the hike no later than 1:40 p.m.  The trailhead is across Dulaney Valley Road behind the chlorination building on the other side of Seminary Avenue.

GPS Trailhead Coordinates, UTM Zone (WGS84) 18S, Easting[masked], Northing[masked], Latitude N 39'[masked]', Longitude W 76'[masked]'

Dogs are welcome on this hike and must be on a leash at all times.  They must also be picked up afterwards.

Please make sure you bring at least 32 ounces of water to drink along with a lite snack if needed.  It is also recommended that you bring hiking boots or shoes that you may get dirty, muddy and/or wet.  Since we are still in tick and chigger season a good bug spray with DEET should be used along with a sunscreen to protect against the sun.  If needed a walking stick or poles may be used.  Also a dry shirt, socks, shoes and a towel are recommended for after the hike.

I will leave it up to the group to decide after the hike if anyone would like to grab a post hike meal. 

If you have any questions or need further information, please feel free to contact me at[masked] or via email at [masked]

Respectfully,

Jim
